headlines.description: Tottenham Hotspur failed to score for a third consecutive game without striker Harry Kane in a 0-0 draw to Watford on Saturday.
headlines.shortLinkText: With no Kane, Spurs fail to score again in draw

headlines.description: Arsenal's Brazilian teenager Gabriel Martinelli seized his chance to shine with a goal on Saturday, but Sheffield United earned a 1-1 draw at The Em
headlines.shortLinkText: Martinelli on target for Arsenal in draw with Sheff Utd

events.name: Aston Villa at Brighton & Hove Albion

headlines.description: Jack Grealish scored a stunning second-half goal as Aston Villa rescued a point with a 1-1 draw against Brighton in the Premier League.
headlines.shortLinkText: Late Grealish goal earns Villa draw at Brighton

headlines.description: A Fernandinho own goal in stoppage time earned Crystal Palace a 2-2 draw away to Manchester on Saturday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Fernandinho own goal sees City draw with Palace

headlines.description: Pitchside monitors were used for the first time in the Premier League as Norwich City earned a crucial 1-0 win over Bournemouth.
headlines.shortLinkText: Norwich beat Bournemouth despite pitchside VAR red

headlines.description: Wolverhampton Wanderers came back from two goals down to beat Southampton 3-2 at St. Mary's in the Premier League on Saturday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Wolves seal 3-2 comeback win at Southampton

headlines.description: West Ham United remained mired in relegation danger after they could only manage a 1-1 draw with Everton on Saturday.
headlines.shortLinkText: West Ham stay in relegation danger after Everton draw

headlines.description: Chelsea fell to a last-gasp 1-0 defeat against Newcastle at St. James' Park on Saturday, thanks to Isaac Hayden's stoppage time winner.
headlines.shortLinkText: Chelsea fall to stoppage time loss at Newcastle
